TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Vinkovci .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Attorney 's Office ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u Vukovaru ) indicted the applicant in ORG ( PERSON ORG ) of the criminal offence of abuse of position and authority ( zlouporaba položaja i ovlasti ) . On DATE a representative of ORG withdrew the charges against the applicant , stating that the facts of the case did not show that the applicant had committed any criminal offence liable to public prosecution . Hence , ORG dismissed the charges against him on DATE . The relevant part of this judgment reads as follows :
“ In respect of the defendant PERSON ...
Pursuant to LAW ,
the indictment is dismissed
that he :

on TIME DATE , in GPE , in his capacity as vice - chief of traffic crime - scene investigation and as chief constable of ORG , after [ having received ] a report of a road accident caused by police officer PERSON while driving a police car ... [ and ] with the intention of helping PERSON avoid responsibility [ for the accident ] and to conceal the whole incident , did not allow the obligatory on - site inspection to be carried out although he had personally visited the site of the accident and ordered the officers in charge , PERSON and PERSON , not to register the said accident in the events register . He certified the register with his signature , thus confirming that during the shift there had been no incidents to be registered , although he knew that it was not true
Reasoning

At a hearing held on DATE the Deputy ORG Attorney , ORG , withdrew the charges against the defendant ... on grounds that he had not committed the said criminal offence , or any other criminal offence liable to public prosecution .

CARDINAL . On DATE a criminalist of ORG FAC postaja ORG ) drew up a report on the events of TIME QUANTITY to DATE . On DATE the applicant was removed from his post . On DATE the Vukovar - Srijemska Police Department lodged a request with ORG that disciplinary proceedings against the applicant be instituted . On DATE the applicant made his statement to an officer of the Vukovar - Srijemska Police Department ( FAC uprava vukovarko srijemska ) , in the presence of his counsel . However , subsequently no disciplinary proceedings were instituted against the applicant . Instead , in a decision of DATE the Minister of the ORG ( GPE unutarnjih poslova PERSON ) , on the basis of the police reports and the written record of the applicant 's statement given on DATE , dismissed the applicant with effect from DATE on the ground that in respect of the road accident which had occurred on TIME DATE he had acted contrary to his duties as a policeman . The applicant lodged an appeal on DATE and the impugned decision was quashed by ORG Upravni sud PERSON ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In a fresh decision of the Minister of the Interior on DATE the applicant was again dismissed with effect from DATE . It was found that on TIME DATE , in his capacity as vice - chief for traffic crime - scene investigation and as chief constable of ORG , he had disregarded his duties in relation to a road accident caused by a police car . After arriving at the scene , the applicant had let those implicated leave the scene of the accident without calling the crime - scene team in order to carry out an on - site inspection . He had further failed to institute adequate proceedings against the perpetrator of the road misdemeanour . He had also instructed the police officers involved to make a deal concerning compensation to the injured party . Furthermore , he had signed the events register , in respect of that night , stating that there had been no incidents to report . Afterwards , he had allowed and arranged for the unauthorised repair of the police car .
The relevant part of the decision reads as follows :

“ As a police officer the defendant ... was under a duty to control and supervise the legality of the acts of other police officers . However , as to the incident in question he acted entirely contrary to this duty and thus allowed the person who had caused the road accident in question to avoid responsibility for it , which clearly shows a disregard for his duties ...

Furthermore , the defendant violated laws regulating the [ police ] service in that he acted contrary to section CARDINAL of LAW ( Zakon o sigurnosti prometa na cestama , Official Gazette no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) which requires drivers who have been implicated in a road accident causing lesser material damage to vehicles to immediately remove those vehicles from the road in order to enable the unhindered movement of traffic and to inform the nearest police station of the accident and to wait for the arrival of an official authorised to carry out an on - site inspection .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Zakon o policiji ) provides that obstruction of duties under paragraph CARDINAL of that section amounts to a transgression of police authority or disregard for the same when a police officer is , according to that LAW , obliged to apply [ his authority , the obstruction ] of which has then caused damage to natural or legal persons or ORG bodies .
As to the case in question , it has been clearly established that the defendant , as a police officer , failed to carry out his police duties in the manner prescribed by LAW .

It has also been clearly established that [ this ] caused damage , both non - pecuniary , ( to the reputation of the police ) , and pecuniary , by causing delays in the proceedings , the lack of sanctions against the perpetrator of a traffic misdemeanour as well as damage to the police vehicle which was not repaired in an adequate manner .

The material damage was caused by a transgression and disregard of police duties by PERSON in that he failed to enforce a fine , in accordance with LAW , against the driver of the police car , GPE ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against the above decision to ORG , challenging the decision on his dismissal . He argued that his right to be presumed innocent had been violated because in the criminal proceedings against him the charges against him which concerned the same facts as those that had served as a basis for his dismissal had been withdrawn . He further complained that prior to adopting a decision on his dismissal ORG had not conducted any proceedings and had not given him an opportunity to be heard in these proceedings , to question witnesses or adduce evidence . He did not ask for an oral hearing before ORG .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld the decision on the applicant 's dismissal . In his subsequent constitutional complaint of CARDINAL DATE the applicant complained , inter alia , that his right to a fair trial and his right to be presumed innocent had been infringed . On CARDINAL DATE ORG ( ORG ) dismissed the complaint as being ill - founded . The relevant part of the decision reads :
“ LAW provides :
Everyone is innocent and no one shall hold him or her guilty of a criminal offence until proved so in a final judgment by a court of law .

The case - file shows that the decision on dismissal and the judgment of ORG are not based on the applicant 's criminal responsibility for a criminal offence , but on the finding that the applicant had transgressed his police authority and disregarded his duty , which resulted in a breach of the regulations on the [ police ] service and a lack of compliance with the duties within the competence of ORG .

Relying on the principles established in its decision no . U - III-CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ( ORG nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , ORG finds that , despite his acquittal in the criminal proceedings against him , the applicant 's dismissal on the grounds under LAW of LAW did not violate his constitutional right under LAW . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Zakon o policiji , ORG no . CARDINAL ) reads :
The Minister of the ORG ... adopts a decision on dismissal from service after obtaining the opinion of the [ officer 's in question ] hierarchical superior .
There is no right to an appeal against the decision under paragraph CARDINAL . Instead , administrative proceedings may be instituted before ORG . ”
CARDINAL . The Administrative Disputes Act ( Zakon o upravnim sporovima , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and DATE ) regulates the procedure before ORG . Section CARDINAL provides as follows :
“ The court decides administrative disputes in a non - public session .
The court may decide to hold an oral hearing on account of the complexity of the dispute or if it otherwise finds it useful for better clarification of the matter at issue .
For the same reasons a party may ask that an oral hearing be held . ”
CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court 's decision no . U - III-CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ( ORG nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , in so far as relevant , reads :

“ The case - file shows that the judgments of the disciplinary courts and ORG did not rely on the applicant 's criminal responsibility for a criminal offence , but found the applicant 's conduct while not on duty , by which he had violated the rules of service and committed a grave breach of work discipline , improper .

The responsibility for grave breaches of work discipline in disciplinary proceedings may be established without a decision of a criminal court , irrespective of the possibility that a breach of work discipline may at the same time amount to a criminal offence . In disciplinary proceedings the features of a breach of work discipline are established and do not require that at the same time the requirements of a criminal offence are met . In that respect disciplinary responsibility is broader than criminal responsibility .

Therefore , despite his acquittal in the criminal proceedings against him , finding the applicant guilty of committing a grave breach of work discipline did not violate his constitutional right under LAW . ”
